text: We recently purchased a Bennington pontoon from Justin Rester and had nothing but a positive experience.  Justin talked us through all the different options in purchasing a pontoon and made helpful suggestions.  He kept us posted throughout the delivery process and even met us on his day off to pick up our boat.  Two thumbs up, would absolutely buy from them again!

name: Prince Homebuilders inc

name: Baxter Jones
text: Excellent company to service your boat. The father and son owners are hands on about quality service. They treat their customers with respect. This company is very trustworthy in that they charge you ONLY for work performed. They also show you the part(s) that had to be replaced. We will always have our boat serviced by this company and will recommend this company to other people.

name: Kevin Koestler
text: So so, needs more attention, but has a ton of potential!!!  Love to develop this place.

name: A. Saye
text: This is the perfect marina to visit if you want to have a short stay, need fuel or if you'd like to live there on your boat for a while.  They have restrooms, showers, washer and dryer, fuel, beach access and a cool place to hang out and cook a burger.  Plenty of slips available.  Staff on duty daily.

name: Deborah Waddell
text: What a beautiful place, beautiful scenery!

name: Rickey Layne McClelland
text: No longer open or operating but, a cool place regardless.

name: Wayne Christensen
text: As a frame of reference for Knoxville, Tenn., folks, Pirates Marina Cove is a rundown version of Duncan's Boat Dock, but with oodles more personality and an even more peaceful setting. The owner, Ed Norton, "The Pirate," will regale you tall tales about Memphis music stars from the early 1900's who came to his marina in Tennessee and about nicknames of former Tennessee Highway Patrol commanders . . .not to mention his 1939 U.S. Navy sub tender that still runs like a charm, his collection of old cars on site, or the ancient yachts at his marina that are about to be restored. An absolute must see!

name: Mac West
text: Great little stop while in town on vacation

name: joe simonton
text: Pirate's marina is closed down no longer open to public

name: Andrea Mann
text: Peaceful

name: ExplorUp LLC
text: No signs, except entrance from right and then you will see falling sign for marina terminal, small place with scale. We were told that they don't have our load, maybe it's across a street!? Went there it's not the company. Went back to original place and had to call dispatcher and broker. Thankfully we got another load from somewhere else.

name: Clarence Slaght
text: Not a bad place to load good people to work with🦆

name: Blake Hayes
text: Quick loading times, not much of a wait, accurate scales

name: Winter Shade
text: Great area to do some fishing. 😊

name: Christopher Ward, Sr.
text: Good night fishing

name: David Walker
text: I bought a pre-owned boat from Jeff. He's very friendly and knows his stuff. I took my Dad along with me. He was impressed as well.

name: Timothy Whalen
text: Expert service. They treated us well. We'll be regular customers.

name: David Mullen
text: Jeff is a great guy and loves a challenge

name: Mark Caffee
text: Friendly people, area is sucluded, very nice place to visit.

name: Leona Smith
text: Docks are in horrible shape, restaurant is closed and falling in, most of the time they're out of bait and gas, workers seem shady

name: David Crauswell
text: Ok

name: Jonathan Orr
text: Fun fishing area

name: Shockwav
text: Great service and super nice people.

name: Robert Hunter
text: Excellent food.  Great atmosphere. Good fishing.  Great laid back atmosphere

name: Elijah Bunn
text: Its very nice and cheap to launch your boat very nice people

name: Bubba Williams
text: Nice !

name: Leona Smith
text: Docks are in poor shape always out of bait and gas, shady people

name: vanna and Emmy
text: It is awful place to go

name: David Crauswell
text: Ok

name: Suzy Griffies
text: We rented a pontoon boat for several days from the Smiths. They were kind, helpful, and available. The boat was in great shape and made our family time even more fun.

name: Chuck Eldred
text: Great ice cream break on the lake ...owners and family very pleasant ...we need to support them and bring them our business !

name: Melise Harris
text: Can NOT say enough about this place. Great food, great froyo great people,  clean and nice facilities.  Love visiting here.

resp.text: Melisa, Thank you for your kind words. We will strive to earn that fifth star from you. Let us know what we need to improve.

name: Crystal Sellers
text: Very nice and quick to serve

name: Tom Wilson
text: Yogurt shop,very nice people, great little break from a boat ride.

name: Curtis Williams
text:
Only place to fill up on this side of lake.

Epic ice cream bar inside!

Friendliest staff you'll ever meet.

name: Mike & Shirley Miner
text: Great staff and customer service...and the yogurt is soooo good! Best place for gas in the area!

name: Joye Brown
text: The yougurt ice cream is awsome. The owners are very friendly. The puppies are sweet.

name: Clint McKelvey
text: Great place and good cold treats!

name: da yolo bro
text: Great yogurt

name: Kevin Wall
text: Great family!!

name: Bobbie “Beautiful Disaster” Abernathy
text: A great working marina

name: Carl Cronin
text: Very friendly and able to answer all my questions. Boat repair done was excellent and within my budget. Would definitely recommend them to friends and family.

name: Dennis Pilarczyk Sr.
text: Great boatyard to "get her done". Owners on site and helpful if you need them. Highly recommended by local knowledge.

name: Wayne Lewis
text: Great those working there are so helpful and prices are right

name: Christopher scarcliff
text: Some of the best seafood you will ever eat!

name: S/V Phoenix and Me
text:
Owner, Mike, is amazing! Very Very knowledge and willing to offer his advice ( read "Consultant Pro Bono"). Never shy to offer assistance in even menial tasks.
He helped me load my sailboat on truck. Lots of people, equipment and yard time. EXTREMELY FAIR PRICE!
NOT ENOUGH STARS FOR THIS PLACE!
Thanks Mike!!

name: Bill Riley
text: These folks are the best people in the world to do business with.  Not only do they care about your boat, they care about you. I'm blessed to know them.

name: Dwight Keener
text: Working boat yard and marina. Great place to be able to work on your boat yourself. Friendly staff.

name: Dot Oliver
text: GREAT PLACE!   FRIENDLY , PROFESSIONAL SERVICES, FAMILY ORIENTED!!

name: Diddle Daddle
text: Live shrimp and great staff

name: Karen Weaver
text: Loved it.

name: Matthew Smith
text: Awesome place

name: Edward Von Lochausen IV
text: Expensive

name: john bolter
text: a+

name: Ethan Heikel
text: This Marina is Awesome! Staff is great! Highly recommend!

name: Frog Price
text: Nice shop and supply choices. Helpful folks work there.modern testing equipment for the mechanics. Also a couple of old dinosaurs working there that know a whole lot about older style engines, hydraulics, transmissions and carbs. Not much they can't handle at this place. We will be using them for a long time to come.

name: Antonio “TONY” Armour
text: GREAT FOOD 👌 AND WONDERFUL SETTING 👍.

name: Stephen M
text: Great location to launch. Plenty of room to maneuver plus lots of parking. A bit hard to find though.

name: Betty Miller
text: This was my 3rd time & it was wonderful!!!!!

name: Wendell Montgomery
text: Its ok i like it

name: Robin Callahan
text: I love this place. The owner and the surroundings are very nice. Everyone respects each other's space and privacy. Great place to camp! Great place for kids as well.

name: Brandon Williams
text: Love going here! Always very nice and we'll kept. A great place to kayak and fish!

name: Steven Miller
text: First visit was great. Stayed the night at the hotel, the staff was very friendly and hospitable. Will be back for sure. Close to EVERYTHING!

name: kita balderrama
text: What a great place,owners treat you like family

name: Clay Council
text: Friendly folks very helpful.

name: Matt Adams
text: Great people, great place for a family

name: Jason Ellison
text: Great group of people.

name: gregory fain
text: Very affordable . Staff are friendly and welcoming.  Amenities are serviceable.  Safe crime free area . Located very close to fuel , haulout,  and boat yard.

name: Ron P
text: Laid back great slip rates

name: Marta Logan
text: Friendly and Great people.

name: William Chesbrough
text: Excellent food, friendly, very fair pricing, easy to get to👍

name: Robert Yawin
text: I live on a boat at sundowner marina. I'm happy with the accommodations here, but my tastes may be different from yours.

name: Ron Dickerson
text: Was very disappointed in this facility.  I called and to start off the conversation the person wouldn't give his name just very short and rude basically not helpful at all.  Apparently If I didn't have a big enough boat for his time he wasn't interested in my call.  Look elsewhere if you want kind and courteous service.

name: David Lloyd
text: A really good place to park and store your boat.

name: Dan Armstrong
text: Repairs and storage on the canal.

name: jmk1292
text: We had a great time fishing with Capt. Randy and his crew. The captain put us on the fish and the crew were very polite and helpful. I would highly recommend this charter

name: Christina Hanna
text:
The Deck hands were GREAT (Jack & Jeff), but unfortunately the captain seemed to have trouble navigating the boat. He’ed tell us to drop our lines and then he’ed move the boat causing our lines to either get caught in the prop or tangled with each other. Meaning 10-15 lines tangled at once multiple times leaving us with only about 20mins of fishing time all together. It was a 2hr trip out there. Once we stopped the first time the captain decided to move location adding an additional 25mins to our non fishing time. He kept blaming it on the current but you would hear him accelerate the engine and then all the lines would end up getting pushed behind us and then he would get mad because all the lines would be back towards the prop and we would have to reel them back up which is what we spent most of our time doing.  We’ve been deep sea fishing several times before so I don’t mind not catching anything because of the weather, etc.,  but I do have a problem with not getting to fish due to lack of caring or inexperience. You know there’s an obvious problem when everyone including the kids are saying to just “stop moving the boat!”
Fishing trip 7/14/21

name: Amanda Scott
text: Our experience was just OK. The crew of 3 on deck were not always attentive when we had fish on the line and had to take them off ourselves. Ran out of bait and had to wait for a refill which lost fishing time. On our way out for the 6 hr trip, an interior window started to fall out of the slot. Didn't think it was a huge deal and would have appreciated if they just stored the glass somewhere safe, but instead they had to stop the boat and all 4 members of the crew took about 15 min to put it back in its place. I thought they would for sure compensate for the lost fishing time, but nope! We pulled back into dock a few min before the end time. I thought this was really rude. Lastly, we tipped the crew as we were getting off the boat a generous amount because we knew we had fish to clean. Come to find out, the fish cleaning is NOT part of the tip we gave and we had to pay even more just to have our fish cleaned. I thought this was a huge rip off and something that should be communicated. I never would have given the tip I did because I didn't think they earned it for what they did on the boat.

name: Craig Driessner
text:
Captain Jack and the crew were awesome! The fish were a bit smaller than 5 years ago when we went with Reel Surprise.  Everyone caught their limit within the 2 hour fishing time. I can't say how awesome these guys are.

The office staff is great too.

All around excellent family fun.

name: David Schumer
text: Highly competent crew. We had very rough seas, but the captain kept us fishing throughout. Moved several times when the fish stopped biting. Each time got us back on the fish. Deck hands were great keeping up with all the fish on. Keeping track of whose fish were whose. Not an easy task at all. Processed the fish after the trip. Made sure to tip them well, for their hard work. Would go back on their boat anytime.

name: Mike Nicholl
text: Great job navigating the gulf waterways we had an amazing time and the office lady Jessica was fantastic

name: Jeffery Mclaughlin
text: Worth every penny! Great customer service and beautiful relaxing views. Very romantic and thoughtful.

name: Larry Windle
text: Around 40 people and no one caught  a fish. Trip that went out before us  slayed them.

name: Becky Krisell
text: I can't say enough of how the captain and his staff cared for my family on our fishing trip. The seas were rough and several were seasick. One of my sons in particular was extremely sick. The captain knew exactly how to care for him. He turned the boat around and refunded everyone their money. Wow is all I can say. Thank you Reel Surprise Charters!

name: Karina Metcalf
text: If you have fished in open ocean a lot, you'll be fine. If not, just know going in that you'll be figuring it out on your own. Not the friendliest crew of young guys.

name: David Poche
text: Great trip went two days in a row and caught several fish and had a great experience will definitely go again

resp.text: Thanks David!  We look forward to you fishing with us again.

name: Connie Gilbert
text: This was the WORST fishing trip, DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY!  Captain didn’t know how to drive the boat straight, we moved majority of the trip got MAYBE an hour of actual fishing & hardly anyone caught any fish. Then deck hand Elizabeth said “well this is a fishing trip not a catching trip!” VERY RUDE & UNPROFESSIONAL!! Do your research people the bad reviews are all true!!

name: cynthia m
text: The fishing itself was ok but it was a “reel surprise” when out fish got mixed up and they kept putting us at the end of the line to get them cleaned. I also asked if there was some other market we could go to to get them cleaned and the captain was very rude. I tipped the deck hands before and asked them to take care of us but that’s not what happened.

name: Joseph Columbus
text: Bottom fishing for snapper mostly when I went. Big boat with a good size interior cabin. Friendly captain and mate. Tried to get enough fish to cook at a local restaurant. I didn't get enough( my fault) but someone gave me a few so it's fresh caught fish for dinner! A couple of hours fishing time with an hour ride back and to the fishing grounds. A bit tricky finding the Marina. Good way to spend the morning.

name: Cathy Richardson
text:
Fun time, Elizabeth was awesome with our first timers.  Staff was friendly and knowledgeable.  We didnt get to keep many fish because it wasnt trigger or snapper season but fun was had by all.
THANK TOU AGAIN REEL SURPRISE and Captain Randy .

resp.text: Thank you, Kathy.  We will make sure that Capt Randy, Elizabeth and the crew know that you left them a 5 star review.  We look forward to having you fish with us again.

name: Justin Jenson
text: Reel Surprise Charters are First Class People. A Once in a Lifetime Family Friendly Experience! I hope to make this an annual trip like most of the other guest that continue to return year after year to fish and create lasting memories with Reel Surprise Charters! Thank you for everything. My family is 'hooked'

name: mobiletrock mobiletrock
text: Nice boat upgrade, should make for a nice ride out. Too rough today for fishing heading back. Better to be safe!

name: nicole fitzpatrick
text: We loved it so much that we went two days in a row! The captain was very nice and did a great job making sure we were on the fish the whole time we were fishing. The deck hands were extremely nice, knowledgeable and worked hard the entire time! We will definitely be back and wouldn't think of going to any other charter.

name: Ashley Baumgartner
text: My family has not stopped talking about their trip.  They loved it.  All three caught fish and had the best time.  Said the captain really knows his stuff and put them right on the fish.

name: Jason Yeager (Jason)
text: The deckhands were friendly and always right there when you needed them. We had a fun quick red snapper trip!

name: Judy Hanson
text: Not the fault of the launch but had to turn around after awile... too rough on the water.  We almost fished but appreciate the safety first policy!!

name: Tina Osborn
text: We had an absolutely awesome fishing trip! Captain Randy is THE BEST! When he found out our son had recently joined the military and wanted to take a fishing trip before leaving for basic training, Captain Randy went out of his way to make our son's trip the very best that it could possibly be! We will be back!! The deckhands (Derik & Russell) are great! So nice and helpful!! If you choose this charter.....you WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED!! 5 STARS!!

name: Kristi Marsh
text: Great times with a wonderful crew! Learned so much and had a blast. Thanks guys!

name: Chad Warren
text:
Went out on the intruder.  They told me it would be 12 people and showed up and there were 15.  Might as well been on a party boat.
We had no room to fish and lines were constantly getting tangled.  The deck hand
did a great job considering.  It even states
On website 14 max to fish.  Doubt if i will be back.

name: Pat Mason
text: Randy and his crew are a fun group to fish with. Large boats , plenty of room to move around. Fun day of fishing

name: Candy Win
text: Don’t waste your money. Spent more time traveling to fishing sites than fishing.  Approximate  travel time was 5 hours out of the six. Not enough deck hands. Kept asking for bait. Had to wait on bait. Lines kept getting tangled and by the time a deck hand untangled your line the captain moved spots. Very  frustrating that there wasn’t  plenty  of time to fish out of six hours. Captains fishing sites were far apart so you spent more time traveling from site to site. Longest time in one fishing spot was approximately 20 minutes. The shortest stop was approximate 10 minutes. We move to five different spots. Traveled a lot.

name: scott walsh
text: My first outing with a boat charted like this and definitely disappointed. We spent more time boating then fishing . the deck hands pretty much ignored use for the first hour and 20 minutes we finally stopped fished for 5 min i caught a fish before i could i.d. it the deck hand cut it free. Not. Cool at least let me know what i caught. We again spent 15 minutes driving we finally stopped and fish. Zero help from the deck hands on how to hook bait properly. We were told they would instruct us the first time. After that it was a fish free for all. Every cramped together trying to fish. Looking back I'd have done a private charter. Also my son and his friend caught nothing we ran out of time.

name: Christi Remaly
text: Reel disappointed!!!! Thank goodness this was not my first party boat fishing charter, otherwise I would probably never step foot on one again after today. We had maybe a total of 2.5 hr’s of fishing time. The 3.5 hr boat “ride” was nice, but not what I was looking for on a supposed 6 hr fishing charter.  Compared to other charters it seemed very unorganized and chaotic. They shorted us 4 fish by putting them in other peoples buckets!!?? Really. Thank god for the normal company we go through,  out of Hudson Marina! They have your buckets labeled and with you at all times. The captain gave minimal instructions on depth and location and  there was absolutely no room to fish properly. Granted the seas were rough but the “novices” we got stuck next to we’re allowed to act like complete careless idiots without correction from the staff. It was also discouraging to know the deck hands were not paid by the charter and basically relied on our tips.  Shame on you Captain. Now I know why the price was cheaper...We tipped them generously and got out of there as fast as possible. I have never been happier to see land!! Trust me, spend the extra money for professionals who take care of their guests and employees.

name: Steve Weissmann
text: Big boat that is stable on the ocean. Good crew and Captain.

resp.text: Thank you, Steve.  We will share your comments with the captain and crew!

name: Skyler Tuttle
text: I went on a shared cost charter today (fishing charter with about 30 people). It was supposed to be a 6 hour trip. Showtime was 8 and we departed at 8:20. We fished 15-20 miles offshore so it took a little under 2 hours each way. We stayed at each fishing hole for about 10 minutes before driving 20 minutes to the next one. With all the driving and getting back 30 minutes early, there was very little time spent fishing. With that being said, the boat caught its limit in red snapper which included a few very nice ones. However, once someone caught their limit, they then catch yours too. If you didn't catch your limit, you get to keep the smallest of someone elses. Instead of a relaxing fishing trip, it was a race to catch fish. Not at all what I wanted/expected, a reel surprise.

name: emmylou dela cruz
text:
This company will give you a real surprise. We rode on the boat for an hour and twenty minutes to find a ton of big fish, but surprisingly majority of them were all small that they needed to be returned to the ocean. We also barely had time to fish because we still had to travel back for another hour and twenty minutes. We wasted 3 hours of boating and an hour for fishing.What do you expect? We got 1 red medium snapper and 8 small gray snapper for 7 fishers, which is better than nothing. The good news is someone gave us extra small fishes. I spoke to people from different charters, saying that they went for boating 20 mins and spent 3 hours fishing.
It was a waste of money and time.

name: Johnny Warren
text: Went on my first deep sea fishing trip yesterday 8/25/2017 Had the time of my life reel friendly grew and very helpful. I'd go again today if I could. Oh and the price was awesome!

name: chuck morgan
text: We spent a week in Orange Beach every year and every year we go on a fishing charter trip with my 2 son in laws, we have gone 4 yrs straight and we have had some bad experiences and some good, but every time we have gone with Reel Surprise the boat has caught our limit and returned early and we have caught several monsters, but overall these guys are excellent and great group of people and our bad experiences have been with Hudson Marine, on one trip, before we left the dock the Captain bragged how great the fishing was going to be and after countless attempts, the majority of the boat never caught a fish and the Captain made excuses the whole way back to shore on why the fish weren’t bitten, just very poor experience

name: teresa lackey
text: We had the best crew ever. They were right there to help you and tell you what to do. It was my grandson first time to go but we will definitely do it again. Caught 8 fish but 4 was out if season but we brought home 3 pounds of red snapper cleaned and ready to cook.  Love yall guys for making a memory that me and Zack will never forget.

name: Dax McDaniel
text: We shopped around at most of the fishing charters and these guys definitely are the best for their money. $65 for a 4 hour trip and it was absolutely worth it. They put us right on the money and are very thorough with their instructions and what fish we are catching and how to catch them. Very professional crew and they cleaned your fish for very cheap. Be sure did bring some cash for the deck hands as it's not included in the price. And that for our trip 3 hours of it was getting to and fro. 18 people fished and caught 90 vermillion snapper since that's what was in season

name: Ronnie Alston
text: Had a good time on this boat. Deck hands answered all my questions and we're attentive.

name: James Cowell
text: First off I paid over $600 for my family of 8 which some were not fishing. We rode for nearly 2hrs and then found a spot to fish. We fished for around 5 minutes & captain decided to move to another spot. We fished for 5 to 10 minutes and he decided to go to another spot which we got there around 20min later and fished for maybe 10min & captain came over speaker saying a lady had cut her hand & we had to leave accidents happen & we weren't upset about it but nearly 2hrs later on which half my family got sick due to the speed and crashing waves we were ramming through to get her back. A family of 8 which 6 were fishing had 4 small fish. I went in to go ahead and tip the deckhands since it wasn't their fault and they did a good job. I asked the lady in the office about some money back since we had fished maybe 30min after paying for 6 hours. They told me that captain Randy was on his way back and would give me a call. We never received the call & have called back around 6 times. I talked to him once and he hadn't had time to look into it. This is the middle of the 2nd day and still no call back. We have called a few more times & hes still not available. I think hes just waiting us out until we go back to Arkansas where we came from which I dont appreciate. I can handle a yes or no but just being ignored. I dont appreciate. This was my kids 1st trip and I work hard for my money just to be ignored isn't an option. I would not recommend this group to anyone. Pay a little more and get a reel professional charter. I know I spelled that wrong on purpose because I got a reel screwin .  They have 1 star since there isn't a 0 star button. This could've been avoided if I could just get a call back and a little professionalism.

name: Doug Gillespie
text: Captain qas great and fishing could not have been better.

resp.text: Thank you!  We will tell the crew!

name: Bradley Force
text: This place is trash! Didnt even show up for there booked trip! I would not recommend them what so ever!

The crew and captain made us feel welcome and appreciated . I would definitely reccommend this charter service to anyone interested in a great time and fantastic fishing

steve

name: Dave Beck
text:
Nice marina. Dock master and staff are helpful and friendly. Courtesy car is a decent minivan. Within a short drive to amenities but no easy way to bike or walk to anything. There is a nice walk around the marina and up to the cove to the West.

Marina has some unusual rules (e.g. $20 to pump out any day but Wednesday which is free and only marina personnel can pump out). New fuel dock is a huge improvement as the old one was horrible.

The town is small and information about hours for stores is frequently incorrect online.

Beware the river in the spring as it rises quicky with storms and becomes treacherous (heavy current, lots of debris). This is a nice marina to wait for the river to fall

Overall, a nice marina with friendly staff that makes the best of its location.

name: K. New
text: A DIY knowledgable & friendly marina with helpful staff. Clean & affordable. Has a boat yard, storage (covered & uncovered), laundry facilities, pool, all you need for a comfortable stay.

name: Matt B
text: Anne Marie was great and went above and beyond to help me purchase an anchor from an out of town slip holder after I lost one of mine. The facility was clean and the showers private. They had the best club house/laundry room setup I had seen travelling from MN to Al. Would stay again.

name: eshanks
text: Pretty amazing place and really nice people

name: Charles Morris
text: This is a first class marina. The dockmaster is the best. Always trying to meet the needs of the boaters.

text: Nice marina.  Very helpful dockmaster, Anna-Marie.  Friendly long-term residents.  Dogs welcome.  Only drawback is that it's not a safe walk to town (highway traffic); but the marina offers a courtesy car.

Our boat has been docked here almost a year,  and we feel like family now. We will keep our boat here until November 1019, when we start The Great Loop.
Anne-Marie is an awesome harbor master!

text: Nice place to visit. The fishing has been changed with the building if the new docks. The place closes early for those who like to catfish. The place has security which is nice but leaves one to wonder why it is needed for a well lit place.

name: Betty Humphrey
text: Beautiful! A shame it isn't used by more people. Nice border walking trail. I loved it ❤️

name: Allen Edgeworth
text: Best place to put in a boat. They have 4 large boat ramps and the pier has rubber bumpers. It is also well lit if you're going at night. This is the easiest boat launch especially when launching by yourself.

text: Great boat launch.

text: Love the swing!

text: Beautiful place

name: Anji Hall
text: Watched the Christmas tree lighting and parade.

name: Nicholas Pohl
text:
Very nice fiberglass catamaran 26’ boats, completely coast guard compliant, all rigging included, modern engines.

The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. We ran into a bad weather issue after an hour on the water, but with the fun we’d already had, we’ll be returning tomorrow morning for some fun in the sun.

I would highly recommend them if you are looking to do some exploring, play on sandbars, fish a bit… whatever.

name: Brandon Williams
text:
GREAT DAY ON THE WATER!

My family recently rented a pontoon boat from Orange Beach Boat Rentals and had a fantastic experience! From making the online reservation, payment, orientation, boat pick up, and drop off processes were super easy.  The entire staff was friendly, informative and very helpful. You can tell they love what they do. The boats were top notch and it even had a restroom.  Would highly recommend and will be back next time we're in OB!

name: Memorie Cole
text: Doug was amazing. Very helpful and accommodating. We had so much fun on the water and have already started planning our next time out

name: Ashley Allerson
text: We had a great day on the water renting a pontoon. Danny was through and knowledgeable and a super cool guy to chat with. The boat was extremely clean and well kept. Pulling back in after a full day was easy to fill up and pass the boat back over. Prices were great and we would definitely rent here again. Thanks Danny!

name: gaye mayo
text: Thank you to Orange Beach Boat Rentals for an amazing time yesterday! My family had an awesome time going to Pirates Cove, seeing dolphins and going swimming! The directions and the GPS are fantastic and having a bathroom on-board is a lifesaver! The directions and it was nice to see that Jack wanted to make sure we knew everything about the boat before we left.  Thanks again Orange Beach Boat Rentals and we can't wait to come back the next time we're in Orange Beach!

name: Karla Thornton
text: Great time, great boat and crew.  Lots of dolphins and seagulls and pelicans.  Just a beautiful day with great tunes playing.  Everyone had a nice time.  Recommend highly!!

name: kevin stutting
text: Capt Danny was awesome! Best renting experience I have had in boat renting. A rental boat with a stereo that was loud and and a 150hp motor that wasn't throttled down. These boats have a head (bathroom) that keeps everything less urgent...

name: David Naylor
text:
Best part of our vacay. First, Captains Igor and Danny are good guys who are knowledgeable, friendly and patient. The boat was immaculate and so nice having a step down bathroom!  Our dog was welcome and he loved it!  They brought fishing stuff for my son when we changed our mind last minute, and got us out on the water quick. Their recommendations of where to catch a fish and where to see dolphins were spot on!

The boat itself was easy to use and had great technology. Good sound system and excellent depth finder / gps. Boat was in tip top shape and easy to use. While I am very experienced on a boat, a beginner could use this pretty easily.

We took the four hour trip. The only problem was we should have gotten the full day rental!!!  Next time!  I will definitely rent from them again.

Final part was the gas up and check for damages. They quickly assessed the boat and saw it was in good shape. Four hours of boat time and just about $20 of gas only, so efficient as well.  No hidden fees or charges at all.

We appreciate y’all making our day so fantastic!

name: Tommie Mccool
text:
Great Rental Company

We had an Amazing day. The check-in process was very thorough and informative. The boats were Amazing and very clean. They were fully loaded with a bathroom, GPS, xm radio etc.
We saw lots of dolphins, fished for a few hours, stopped by a beautiful sandy beach island and had lunch at Tacky Jack's.  We have rented boats from all over, and this company really stands out, we were impressed all the way around. Great Boats! Great Service! Great Day!  Top Notch Service. We will be back next time.

name: Ryan Files
text: We rented one of their pontoon boats a couple of weeks ago. Fantastic experience! The boat was in great shape and they provided a map that was extremely helpful for our navigation. Everyone there was a pleasure to deal with and I wouldn’t use anyone else after such a great experience. I highly recommend!

name: natalie mrocek
text:
AMAZING DAY!

Amazing day on the water. I am so glad we decided to rent a boat for the day. We saw lots of dolphins, got to hang out on a island, go fishing and had our best day on vacation on the back bays of Orange Beach on the boat.  Customer service was Awesome. We can’t wait to rent from Orange Beach Boat Rentals again very soon. Highly recommended!

name: Richard Dias
text: Orange Beach Boat Rentals was fantastic. Captain Igor did an excellent job with boat preparation. There is a video that explains the safety features of the boat and of proper etiquette for traveling on the Inlet. Captain Igor then reviews any questions you have. Our boat was well-maintained and very clean. Our entire family had a great day on the water seeing dolphins and finally stopping at a beach. I would recommend orange boat rentals to everyone. When our family goes again no doubt where I will go to rent a boat.

name: The Nortons (Jenny)
text: Our family had a great time on the water thanks to Orange Beach Boat Rentals! Danny was very knowledgeable about the area and helpful at check in and the boat was perfect for a family! We saw so many birds and dolphin! Highly recommended!

name: ihyzey
text: We had a blast. Worth every penny. Danny was amazing. Customer service was awesome and you don't get great customer service too much anymore. You can tell they love what they do. We arrived and everything was ready to go. They made it so nice and easy.

name: Christopher McCarthy
text: Had a blast! Great training video. GPS and hand map made it SO enjoyable.

name: Natalie Whitehead
text: A great family excursion! We saw dolphins, caught fish, and had plenty of room on the boat for 5 of us. Plus, we went out in the rain, and the people at Orange Beach Boat Rentals told us to keep the boat out for a couple of extra hours no charge in order to make up for subpar conditions. We didn’t ask for it; they just kindly offered. Such great service!!

name: kenneth gossett
text: Came down here on vacation, we have used a few different boat rental places so far and we definitely saved the saved the best for last. Best boat rental by far. Very clean, very respectful and courteous staff, with top of the line boats! These guys will not disappoint!

name: Bill Knox
text: April and Capt Danny were amazing in helping us with our fishing trip.  Their prices were competitive, but their service was off the hook - much like my bait.  We will be back for more.

name: Jeff McLaughlin
text: Boat itself was very enjoyable. Family loved it. However, April whomever that may be sorely needs a class in customer service and has an issue with feeling the need to be correct. Even with a paying customer.

name: Kate Green
text: Rented a boat full day on May 19th. It was the best day we had on vacation by far. Family owned very friendly. We loved the boat super comfortable sat 6 comfortable and could have sat more. Will definitely rent again when in town.

name: Michael R
text: Wonderful Time for the Family! Thanks Captain!

name: Shell Mitchell
text:
Amazing Day! Highly Recommend!

Yesterday was our 2nd time renting with Orange Beach Boat Rentals and we love their boats and their Amazing customer service. We have rented from many other rental companies and they by far have the nicest boats. We love the convenience of the restroom and the garmin gps. The orientation is very detailed and thorough. We saw lots of dolphins, went to pirates cove and did a little fishing. Once again my families favorite day of our vacation. We highly recommend Orange beach boat rentals. Highly Recommend!

name: Heather Roaden
text: Best Day on vacation!! Kids had a blast catching fish! Customer service is amazing!!! Very clean and well maintained boats! Got to see alot of Dolphins!

name: Sydney Verant
text: I highly reccomend a full day boat rental so that you have time to go to the beach, go fishing , hit the restaurants (I reccomend pirates cove), and see the dolphins. Go to the beach earlier when there are less people and drive slowly to see the dolphins. There may be a shrimp boat throwing over their unwanted catch where the dolphins are hanging out. You can buy some shrimp right from the boat too, but dont feed the dolphins: it's illegal.

name: Sherrill Mitchell
text:
Excellent Boat rental company

We rented a boat from Orange Beach boat rentals on Saturday. We had a group of 8 and it was very comfortable. The boats were extremely clean, we loved having a restroom onboard, and they rode so smoothly. We had such a great day.  Everything about this company was professional and smooth, from booking the reservation, to being greeted and instructed during the orientation., they gave us all the local tips and recommendations, which was right on point. We highly recommend renting from orange beach boat rentals and will be back soon.

name: John
text:
Great boat rental company. Highly recommend going to Robinson Island area.. there’s lots of restaurants and bars. You can also park your boat on the sandy island just south of Robinson Island (many people go there).
The instructions and orientation of the boat is from a simple 10 minute video on an iPad they give you.

name: Debbie Mcneal
text: These guys are awesome. They give you the best service in Orange Beach. They take really good care of their equipment. Have no junk. Best boat ride and fishing trip I've ever been on. Please contact them for all your boating needs when your at beach. You want be disappointed.

name: Craig Anderson
text: Great experience! I have rented from several places in OBA, and this was the easiest by far.

name: Ryanne Riegling
text: We've rented boats from many different places and this was by far the best. Very good pricing, excellent boat! The catamaran has a bathroom in it, which was super helpful since we were out all day. The boat was outfitted with a GPS / fish finder and the company provided a very detailed map to go along with it. The gulf is quite a large area and this made it very easy to navigate.

name: Kevin Tuttle
text: Me my family had a great time anybody that complains about the $75 charge cost for running into sand bar are idiots or must be drunk  and not paying attention I had no problem  with the state-of-the-art of quipment that they supply I also went to Robinson beach but I did not beach the boat I went to the radar showed 2' and had no problem my family swam we caught fish the great thing about it was the bathroom for my small children was the excellent decision we had a great time rented for a whole day Jack the deckhand did a excellent job in explaining everything and showed great care for my children and safety I would definitely rent from them again no questions asked it was a great experience

name: Rachael Austin
text: Fantastic boat rental company! They are very thorough and make sure your boating needs are met. They provide great customer service and the boats are easy to operate and fully equipped. Will be renting from them again, hopefully soon!

name: Steve Vance
text: Great company that truly understands customer service. They went out of their way to ensure our day was trouble free and enjoyable with a very structured introduction to the boat and area. Although, the most important touch was their genuine care for my son who was sick the night before, checking on him even after our boat ride. Class acts.

name: Shqne 850
text: Had a great time! Knowledgeable staff, showed us fishing spots and where to go for some good food! Very clean boats. 10/10 I will definitely return!

name: Albert Garcia
text:
Absolutely Fantastic!!!!
We rented a boat yesterday from Orange Beach Boat Rentals, and had the BEST Day ever. Our family of 5, 2 adults and 3 kids spent most of the day at the island swimming and hanging out on the beach, the island was such a fun atmosphere, my kids played with all the other kids, we had a picnic on the beach, and got a nice tan. On our way back in we saw lots of dolphins, they are just amazing to watch, and our on private dolphin show.  Our check in process was super easy, Igor gave us a very detailed orientation and explained to us how to stay safe. The boat was Very nice, it had a full restroom, a nice stereo system, comfortable cushions a canopy to get out of the sun, our motor was super quiet and cranked on the 1st turn, in the past we rented from other companies, and their boats don't even come close to Orange Beach Boat Rentals. We can't wait to come back. We highly recommend!

name: Brenda O’Quinn
text:
Best Day Ever!

We had a Great Day. The boats were very nice. We saw dolphins, went to pirates cove and swam near the islands. The boat was very nice and had a lot of get up and go power. We were a family of 7, with 2 small kids, they napped perfect on the boat, as the back of the boat had a nice canopy and comfortable seat cushions. We couldn’t have asked for a better day on the water. We will be back in a few months and will only rent from Orange Beach Boat Rentals, as they truly are the Best.

name: Kelly Robertson
text:
Amazing Boat Rental!
We rented an 8 hour boat rental yesterday for our family of 5. It was a perfect day. Igor did our orientation he was very nice and answered all of our 150 questions. The boats were very nice and clean, the restroom was such a nice bonus. The shallow water alarm was very helpful of keeping us away from the sandbars.
We spent most of the day on Bird Island, and stopped by Pirates Cove on our way back, then finished the day watching all the beautiful dolphins.  We have rented from many companies before and Orange Beach Boat Rentals does it right. We Highly recommend them, and we can’t wait to come back and rent again.
Robertson Family

name: Emma Whitlock
text:
Amazing Boats!
We had a Great day on the water. We spent most of the day watching dolphins, swimming, fishing. The boats were perfect, very clean and had lots of extras. We loved having the restroom, the shallow water alarm kept us safe, the islands were beautiful. It was an Anazing day. We can’t wait to go again. I highly recommend Orange Beach Boat Rentals, as they made sure to cover all the details to make our day perfect.

name: Timothy Thurnes
text: Friendly and helpful staff. Equipment is clean and in great condition. We really enjoyed the experience.

name: Keila Morse
text: It was not very luxurious but they had a small toilet on board.

name: Mike
text:
These people are top notch. Very nice and informative. We took our 6 year old out and let him catch fish. Captain Egor was busy but still was more than happy to answer any questions we had. He led us right to the fish. You get a map with Fishing spots,restaurants,dolphins and other attractions that’s easy to follow. I will be renting another boat from them next time I come.
As far as the prop goes: don’t run it in the sand and you won’t be charged. Pay attention to the channel markers and the gps mapping that is provided on the boat. It only takes common sense. As a boat owner myself I know how expensive props and lower units are so I completely understand there charge for running there boat aground.

name: Marylynn Dibble
text:
Fun day on the water!!!!
My family took a boat out yesterday with Orange Beach Boat Rentals. It was a Awesome experience from the time of booking till the very end. Fantastic boats with a nice Restroom, lots of room. It had a GPS on it with a shallow water alarm which kept me away from the sandbars. We went to pirates cove and had a cheeseburger in paradise, we saw so many dolphins and had the best day of our vacation. Orange Beach Boat Rentals really made us feel welcome, and even gave us some great tips where to take our kids fishing. We have rented from several other companies and this was the Best experience we have ever had, we will defiantly be back. Thank you again, my kids will talk about this day forever now.

name: Momma Savannah
text: Awesome day on the water!!!!!  My family absolutely had the best day on the water. The boat was Great, it had a nice canopy so my kids could stay in the shade, a Full RESTROOM, which was so convenient, a stereo system which was awesome while we were parked at the islands, and lots of storage for our stuff. This was not our 1st time out with Orange Beach Boat Rentals, and we will be back again next year, Thanks Again for a Awesome day on the water..

name: Jason Easter
text:
The BEST - only rent here!

My family and I rented a boat for the day & were EXTREMELY impressed!! Such great service, attention to detail, nice clean boats & most of all personal, professional service from a husband & wife team.  They went over in detail with us on how to operate the boat safely, understand the GPS and the shallow water alarm, and even gave us a laminated map with all the local waterfront resturants, fishing spots and where the Islands were. As another reviewer said -they have great reviews for a reason! We felt personally welcome & safe on the boat & they wanted us to enjoy our experience. We saw 24 dolphins- no kidding- all on our own as we cruised the back bay areas. Better than any dolphin cruise we have ever been on- our 2 boys (7 & 9) loved it! We rented some fishing equipment for our boys & it was perfectly prepared and on the boat for us when we arrived. Can't say enough about how impressed we were with Orange Beach Boat Rentals, as we have rented from other companies in the area and we will be back with them on our next trip to Orange Beach.  Call early to reserve as they do book up!

name: Brian Handke
text:
Awesome!!!
That is the only way this company can be described.  They go above and beyond on everything, the boats are great, the GPS is great, the maps are unbelievably detailed, the video explaining everything, Jack then went over everything again and even helped us load and unload the boat.  We rented for 8 hours and ran all the way up to Perdido Key bridge then down to Robinson Island and back and only used $40 in gas.  Got to see a bunch of dolphins, had a blast at "hermit crab island" near Holiday Harbor, and had an awesome time at Pirate's Cove, letting the kids swim while we waited on our food.  Really can't say enough good things about these folks, will definitely rent from them again when we come back!!

name: Kristy Santa Cruz
text:
Awesome Boats! We had so Much Fun!!

My family of 5 had a wonderful day on the water. The boat was spacious, very clean, and very well equipped with lots of extras, including a Restroom, GPS and large map, it even had a radio with xm radio. Much better than others that I had looked at in the area. I booked online, it was very easy, and they emailed me my confirmation, and directions.  Igor was very friendly, patient, and very informative during our orientation he explained to us how to stay off the sandbars, and gave us some great fishing tips too. We had a great, safe day on the water, we should have applied more sunscreen as we were all having so much fun and forgot.  Will definitely rent from Orange Beach Boat Rentals again. Thank you so much for such a wonderful trip! Our kids can't stop talking about how much fun they had!

name: Meagan McClain
text: Thoroughly enjoyed our time on the water, great recommendations with places to eat and where to fish and see dolphins. Pirates cove will definitely be a place that we revisit. We will be using orange beach rentals again.

name: Adam Austin
text:
I COULDN'T BE HAPPIER WITH THIS TRIP!
I called to rent a boat for me and the wife to go out for a day! Booking was easy and Captain Igor met us at the boat launch to explain boat safety and great places to explore. Rachael and I spent all day boating! Robinson Island was our fun and the water was so clear that day. We felt like we were in the Bahamas. We explored some of the bay and stopped by Pirates Cove for a drink. We loved seeing the dolphins and the sunset on the way back was beautiful. The boat was clean and in good condition. Overall, very pleased with this trip!

name: Cazes Martin
text: Our family rented a boat for the day and had a perfect time. Boat was clean and  comfortable and ran perfectly. Igor and April were very friendly, attentive and professional and were genuinely focused on assuring that we had a nice day. I've been going to the Gulf Shores area for 30 years and had never rented a boat to explore the back waters - we'll have a boat day every year from now on!

name: Monica Sands
text:
AWESOME! AWESOME! AWESOME!
We rented a boat yesterday June 8th, 2017 from Orange Beach Boat Rentals.  Everything was just Amazing, we rented some rods and bait, and they had it ready on the boat when we got there, he showed us on the map where the fish were biting the day prior and gave my son some great fishing tips.  After fishing for a few hours, we did catch and release, we ran into a group of about 15 dolphins, they were so graceful and beautiful, we had our on Private Dolphin Cruise.  We then pulled into Ingram's Bayou, which was easy to find from the map that was provided to us and we swam for a while, then went back out and watched the dolphins some more. Then we pulled up to a secluded beach and found some nice treasures to take back with us " shells, driftwood etc."  It was such a perfect day, and Igor and April was so accommodating, we felt so welcome on their boats, and they really went above and beyond in many ways. There was even a restroom on the boat! The GPS was a huge plus and the shallow water alarm kept us away from the sandbars.  So glad we found Orange Beach boat rentals, we will make this a annual trip now.  Thanks Again so much from the Sands Family!

name: Sunshine S.
text:
BEST BOAT RENTALS ON THE ISLAND!!!

Starting from the time of booking "which we did online" to the emailed instructions & directions to our orientation, then a great day on the water,  up until we unloaded from our day on the water was smooth and enjoyable. We loved the boat, the restroom was a great bonus as well as the gps which made navigation around the shallow areas easy. We spent most of the day at the islands, found some shells, did a little fishing and saw lots of dolphins. We ate lunch at Tacky Jacks, we just pulled right up on the boat and tied up, super convenient. We have been coming to Orange Beach 1-2 times a year for the last 10+ years, and we will Only rent from Orange Beach Boat Rentals from now on.  Great People and Great Boats!

name: Dusty Bias
text:
I have rented from Orange Beach Boat Rentals multiple times over the years. I have always had the best experience and really felt like we got the best bang for our buck. The boats are reliable, clean, and properly prepared to accommodate the needs of any boater.

The bays around Orange Beach can be challenging and confusing for someone who has never spent time boating in the area. Orange Beach Boat Rentals does a fantastic job giving a quick and thorough tutorial of the the local waters, preparing you for a fun and safe day boating.

name: Katy Marie Heick
text: We recently rented a pontoon boat from Orange Beach Boat Rentals and had a great experience! The reservation, payment, pick up, and drop off processes were easy peasy. Igor and Jack were friendly and definitely knew what they were doing. Would recommend and will be back next time we're in OB!

name: David Barajas
text:
This operation is phenomenal!! - No rigid fixed time slots, very accommodating and great services!

My family was in Orange Beach for a USSSA World Series torny and
my grandson had a very tight schedule..

I needed to start our day earlier than their normal time, and wanted to use the boat for 6 hours instead of their normal 4.. NO PROBLEM!

We had a great time out, saw lots of wildlife, birds, dolphins and
had a great time fishing.

Boats are clean, easy to handle, and staff is top notch!!
Made a great addition to our vacation.

If I'm ever back in this area I will definitely use them again.

Thanks to all!

name: Ron Thrift
text:
HIGHLIGHT OF OUR VACATION !!!
Thank you Igor a April for our smooth experience.
Great directions, pleasant boat orientation, clean and reliable boat
with a restroom aboard ! Map and GPS were great, XM radio jamming..
WE LOVED THE BEACHES, PIRATES COVE AND ABUNDANCE OF DOLPHINS ALL AROUND !
I am so glad that we have booked week in advance before all boats were taken. We will be back next year!
Highly recommend to any family visiting Orange Beach

name: Tomas Kratochvil
text:
Best Boat Rental!!!

Nicest boat we have ever rented, it looked like a personál boat and not a normal standard rental. The restroom was a huge bonus. Very comfortable and smooth ride. Igor was very professional and provided us with some local knowledge of where to go and we had a awesome day on the water. I will be reccomending Orange Beach Rentals to all my friends and family. Amazing day.

name: Caleb Santa Cruz
text: Very fun atmosphere! The boat was clean and comfortable. Our captain made it a very fun, safe trip and my family and I thoroughly enjoyed it. We will definitely be using A-Pair-A-Dice Charters again and I would recommend them to anyone!

name: Jackie Thurnes
text: Super friendly! Great advice on lunch, fishing and dolphin watching!

name: Archie Little
text: Great experience. Enjoyed the day. Nice friendly service.

name: Shell Mitchell
text:
Amazing Operation! Highly Recommend.

They run a top notch operation, our boat was Amazing, clean, had a full restroom, lots of other extras and a Yamaha 150hp motor that had some get up and go, these boats are Amazing unlike other rental companies who we have rented from  in the past which had 60hp motors, which were loud and smoked on us the whole time.  We saw 20 + dolphins, were able to visit Pirates Cove and the Flora Bama Yacht club in the same day, such a fun filled day, we can't wait to do it again. We will only rent from Orange Beach Boat Rentals in the future, we highly recommend them. Thank you for truly making our day Amazing.
Thank you- The Mitchells

name: Brandon barenis
text: Had a great time. The boat had very good equipment and was also very clean! There was also a bathroom on board which other rental boats we looked at didn't have.

name: Kristy Beard
text: This was our 2nd time renting from Orange Beach Boat Rentals, and it was once again a Great experience. We had such a perfect day on the water we saw lots of dolphins, went over to pirates cove, and we all got way to much sun ;)  We love their boats compared to others we have rented in the area. The restroom is super convenient, the xm radio is great, and loved the power of the 150 hp motor, and the boat rides super smooth. Once again they exceeded our expectations. They also have a great map which makes it easy to navigate. We can't say enough good things about this company, they are truly a pleasure to rent from. We can't wait to rent again and go back out on the beautiful bays of Orange Beach.

name: Talk Time
text: We were going to rent a boat, but opted for a private shrimping cruise after talking to April!  Our captain was Matt, and he was amazing!  He was a family man and very knowledgeable about the area as well as the marine life.  We got to see and touch stingrays, flounder, shrimp, catfish, squid, jelly fish, and other fish!  The dolphins swam up close to the boat and sprayed us several times!  The dolphin cruise boats followed our boat for dolphin sightings for about 5 minutes.  We also got to hang out at Pirate's Cove.  It was the highlight of our trip!

name: Wendy GODWIN
text:
Best Rentals on the Island!

Nicest boats we have found and they had power (Yamaha 150hp)  We rented the boat on Memorial Day weekend and went over to Pirates Cove it's a awesome place to visit, then we went over to the islands and the kids played and swam, and we even saw dolphins while we were there. Then we went over to Tacky Jacks on the water, and just pulled in and got out and ate lunch, that was pretty cool.  They meet us on the boat at 9am (our scheduled time to arrive) did our orientation and gave us all the pointers we needed to find the dolphins and the better fishing spots too, and fitted the kids with life vest.  We rented a few rods from him, and he had everything already on the boat when we got there.  So just to sum it up, we went fishing, stopped by pirates cove, hung out at the islands for a couple hours, ate lunch at a waterfront restaurant, saw dolphins, and my kids even napped on the ride back to the marine. We had such a fun day and can't wait to do it again.

name: Fabio Soller
text: Awesome Day on the Bay!! We had one day to play while coming to mobile and we chose to rent this boat.. it's not a pontoon but more like a small catamaran  but we had a wonderful time the boat was amazing and it had a bathroom which is a huge plus, and a really nice stereo system..  We rented fishing rods and bait and fished all over the bay.  Everything was in perfect condition and captain Igor was awesome and made sure we had everything we needed . He gave us a map so we could stop and dock the boat and eat at some of the restaurants along the bay ... on our way back in the evening the dolphins were everywhere and they were jumping and playing . We kept our distance and didn't want to disturb them but they were so beautiful to watch ...if you make the trip to robinsons island it's about a 45 min ride and it's usually busy there but it's beautiful and a great swimming area, we had a fantastic day and highly recommend Orange Beach Boat Rentals to all our friends.

name: Kacie Pipkins
text: The boat was very nice. But just like another person said in the reviews if you rent from this company be prepared to pay the extra $75 dollars for prop damage. Me and my family has owned a boat for many years and simply hitting sand one time does not damage the prop. They paint fresh red paint on the bottom of the prop and if any lil bit of paint is gone they are gonna charge you. It's a complete rip off. And just like they did on the last persons review they are gonna come onder my review and try to defend there selves. We saw this review prior to renting from this company and didn't really think any thing of it. But like I said the boat was nice and Yes it has state of the art equipment on it but that still doesn't always prevent you from bumping some sand. So be prepared to pay the extra $75 or just don't stop at any island.

resp.text:
We are very sorry about your additional cost due to running into the sand.
The reason the paint looks shiny and wet is because it’s an Epoxy paint - hardest paint known, which cures with shiny Amino blush film on top.
Most of our customers do not have issues with bumping into the sand
also we only charge the prop fee if damage is medium to severe.
We are truly sorry,  Capt. Igor

name: Israel Pipkins
text:
I was satisfied with the trip up to the point I was informed I would owe an additional 75$ due to the fact I scratched some of the red paint,  that Orange Beach Boat Rentals, had hand painted on the skeg. Which is the fin below the propeller. This is painted solely for the purpose of seeing if this fin has touched sand. Keep in mind, this is hand paint that was painted on moments before rental. Which will come off just by operating this boat. I asked exactly what damage had been done to the prop, and I was told I had damaged the (Stuff) inside the the propeller.  When asked which part? Like, shaft, bearings, gears, or seals! He was confused and only could explain that if the paint was gone the lower unit was damaged! The boat was returned in perfect working condition. But I was still charged an additional 75$. I bought this mistake. There is no need for u to do so as well. Consider someone else for your rental needs or be prepared to pay an additional 75$ God Bless! And safe travels!
It is very unfair to assume everyone that rents from you is uneducated in the operation of a boats lower unit. You see I grease my own foot, change my own water pump, and props. I service my own Yamaha outboard. I understand you are used to dealing with those who do not do these things. That's why it's only fair for me to share this to help them out before they do business with you!

resp.text:
We are very sorry about your additional cost due to running into the sand.
Yes we paint the lower part of the motor so we know if lower unit been digging thru the sand.
Your statement that we painted it moments before the rental is false. The reason the paint looks shiny and wet is because it’s an Epoxy paint - hardest paint known, which cures with shiny Amino blush film on top.
Yes we brush it on by hand, because spray-paint is 4-5 times thinner. It does not come off at all unless you drag  4000 Lbs boat thru the sand. It’s a lot of wear and tear.
Prior every departure, there is 15min orientation on video which clearly explain the operation around sandbars,
the GPS shallow water alarm and there is a special section informing you if you run into the sand there is a $75 charge. No hidden fees, everything is loud and clear upfront.
I would like to believe, We have it almost foolproof, There is GPS which color-marks shallower waters less than  6 feet in blue color, Deep water is white color. You go less than 3 feet –alarm sounds.
While cruising sandbars are bright yellow visible from a distance by untrained eye.

We specifically ask in the video to not beach the boat due to our shallow access. We ask to keep the boat floating in at least 2 feet of water with motor trimmed up.
I am sorry my helper Stahl was not able properly explain the damage of the Propeller’s  hub.
(Rubber and composite bushing between the transmission drive shaft and Prop it’s self)
This is a sacrificial part to protect $ 2,600 lower unit.  Can’t be seen by eye, it’s inside the prop.
Cost of this Power-tech hub is $ 69.00 plus $ 6.00 shipping, labor 45 min on my end – No charge.
If prop shop does it, cost is $ 280.00 .  Damage does not stop here, as the propeller work in the sand the blades loosing the cup. (ability to scoop water and go forward, start just slicing water, Rpm running high and boat does not go fast anymore). Replacement cost $ 630.00
I am losing more than you  with your damage.

You present yourself as a motor educated person and trying to help out other people.
We thank you. We are honest and we go beyond, our boats are nicest on the island.

Captain Igor

name: Jennifer Hanger-Musson
text: What a great experience.   Igor was awesome and explained everything perfectly!

name: Carol Thrift
text: What a fun day on the water. The boat was super nice, had a full restroom, nice stereo system, comfy cushions, it was by far the nicest rental we have ever rented. We went to Pirates Cove and had a bushwacker and a cheeseburger, drove around saw tons of dolphins, then went over to the island and collected seashells and played in the water. It was a pefect day, we will defiently be renting from them again, Highly recommend Orange Beach Boat Rentals!

name: Loredana N
text: booked a pontoon when showed up they  told me -its rented out they apologize but they  can give me newer one almost 200$ more then we have agreed . they acknowledge their mistake but wouldn't do anything to fix it .we were  very upset especially kids  ((((

resp.text: PLEASE DELETE THIS FALSE REVIEW!!!!  I'm Sorry, but you are mistaken, you have written this review under the wrong company, you may be speaking of OB Watersports, but we are Orange Beach Boat Rentals, we are at the Wharf Marina in Orange Beach, not Tacky Jacks area in which you are speaking of. You are not a customer of ours, or ever spent money with us.  We take payment at the time of booking, there is NO way for us to give your boat to someone else, because you have already paid for it.  Please kindly remove this false review from our company.  If your still in the area we would love the opportunity to serve your family, we promise to give you the Best Customer Service possible.

name: Cory McCreary
text:
We really enjoyed our two week stay here! Friendly tenants and staff. Quiet at night and spacious, gravel spots. Every site has a fire pit and picnic table. The community areas are great even though they removed the game room due to a fire. Bathrooms and showers are remodeled and clean. The laundry room is in need of an update but there are many  laundromats nearby if needed. Unfortunately, the WiFi is too weak to even connect to. Despite that, we would definitely stay here again.

Just to note, it IS next door to a recycling plant but the noise was not bothersome to us. Also just to be aware, there are factories across the river that sound alarms on Mondays that could be mistaken for emergency alerts but are not.

*** Because the WiFi issue is out of their control, I updated my review to 5 stars instead of 4.

resp.text: Thank you for your generous review.  The laundry room is currently being updated with the addition of more machines.  And yes, we despise the internet issue ourselves.  Unfortunately, we're located in a "non-growth area", so getting service is not possible, or fiscally not viable for our small business.  We're hoping we can get Starlink SOON!

name: Lisa Allred
text: Very impressed with all the improvements done at Jays! So nice!

name: Jessica Parker
text: We stayed here 6 nights and had no internet the entire time. The lady at checkin stated that the company who had contracted to put internet and cable in had reneged on the work. Price per night should reflect lack of amenities stated on website. There is no clubhouse because the main office burned down and they converted the clubhouse into their main office. Neighboring noise from recycling plant during the day was annoying but tolerable. We felt like the price per night should have been between $30-$40 per night compared to other parks we have stayed in. Lake is beautiful and we enjoyed walking along the waters edge.

name: Jim Shrader
text:
We've stayed at Jay Landings twice and were pleasantly surprised by all the updates. Elizabeth, Veronica and the staff are very friendly and were accommodating when we had to change reservations several times due to Covid restrictions.
The campground is clean with amazing views of the Tennessee River. Yes there are lots of full time campers but everyone is respectful and it's quiet at night. And the Sunsets are incredible.
We look forward to going back to one of our Homes away from Home.

name: Clay Baldis
text: Very nice facilities, love having my boat here!

resp.text: Thanks! We love having y’all here!

name: Daniel Lucas
text: Friendly staff, and one of the lower costs in the Huntsville/Decatur area.

name: kennykaren brown
text: We came to Jay Landing on Super Bowl Saturday for a  3 month stay.  From the minute we arrived Valerie took very GOOD care of us.  On Sunday Joel and Elizabeth the owners threw a SUPERBOWL party worthy of Hollywood and   We met all our neighbors. This is a beautiful campground and Marina located right on the Tennessee River.  We have camped all over this USA and this is one of my favorite places.  EVER!!  I would highly recommend you check it out.   We hope to be back.

name: george bush
text: We are moving into the Jay's Landing RV Park for 5 to 6 months while the new house is built.  Jay's Landing is very clean and quiet.  Pool, laundry and right on the water if you have a boat.  Thus far we are very impressed and happy to be bere.

resp.text: Thank you, George. We are striving each day to finalize improvements. We hope all goes well with the process of building a new home. What an exciting time!

name: Daniel Ray
text: Nice cozy place right on the river.  They had a pool, game room, first-come first-serve paddle board, kayaks, paddle boat.  Also a places to swim and fish(license required) in the river.

name: Linda mrsgagrandma@bellsouth.net
text: Never checked iin spoke to them late Friday afternoon and gave 100 electric deposit called them Monday morning early and said plans changed on the job and wouldn't be coming and they said we used all but 4.00  of the deposit for the time we used we never checked in and  was there . Be careful

name: Warner Arthur
text:
we had a great campsite, number 14. Water front and great view. Staff are all great. We did go thru tornado sirens and loud speakers saying to take shelter but I felt there was no place to go. We saw some folks around the bathhouse, but I doubt that would protect much.
The industrial complexes around us were 24/7 noise but inside we did not mind too much.  The paved road into the camp had huge dips and then also speed bumps, which really rocked the RV and the one near the road was so deep we bottomed out the hitch.

name: Linda Gipson
text: Beautiful place to visit for your RV parking or boating family fun

name: Kelvin Tigner
text: Good people and no drama

name: Ruben Moralez
text: Overall this was a nice place to stay, recent upgrades were done to the road and bath houses. The pool was added but like every downside I’m going to mention, you have to pay to get your key pass and be sure not to loose it! The rent is supposed to be set but you’re always charged extra ALWAYS. I ended up paying 100 more every month because I went over my electricity supposedly. Other then paying more every month I’d say it wasn’t a bad stay the management is friendly for the most part I never had any issues with them. The spots are extremely tight and you can pretty much hear everything your neighbor is doing. There are loud noises from the plants around the park especially on the weekends.

resp.text:
Thank you, Ruben, for your reply.  It allows us to provide information to future guests.   I'd like to respond to your "downsides".

Yes, we collect a $20 deposit on the "key pass" to the pool, which is similar to a hotel key to provide safe passageway into the pool for authorized users.  What you failed to mention is that you get that $20 back when you return the key, so you're not out any money.

Secondly, the sites are metered, and tenants are charged .16/kWh for power usage, and one is invoiced anything usage over the $50 allowance.  Anyone is welcomed to monitor their usage by taking note of the meter reading.  It's certainly unfair for a 22' unit to have to pay a higher rent to cover the usage of a 42' unit which has 2 or 3 air conditioner units, therefore, we keep all things even by giving each monthly guest a $50 allowance toward their power.  How they use it is up to the tenant.  You were also here during the summer months when temperatures were extremely high and often record-setting, so yes, you would more than likely have a higher power usage to keep the camper cool.

Thirdly, the site you were on is one of our smaller and cheaper sites.  We have larger sites as well.

Lastly, we are located next to a scrap yard, and they do move scrap around 6 days a week.  Their weekend noise is no different than during the week.  You must have just been off on the weekends to hear it.

And yes, we're continuing to make improvements on the property, including the addition of 21 more sites so we may welcome more guests!

name: Gloria Schulte
text: Nice place. Bathrooms and showers are very clean. Pool is great. Not in great neighborhood but park is gated. Small but you can tell owners try to keep it maintained.

resp.text: Thank you, Gloria. I’d like to clarify. please. The area is safe, it’s just in an industrial area. Safe travels!

name: Carlton Daggett
text: Highly recommend. Friendly staff, Nice pool, Water front Views. No problems with tenants here. I have been staying here for over a month now.

resp.text: Thank you, Carlton!  We are continuing to make improvements, so for you to take the time to post something positive is appreciated!

name: Calista Hans
text: Great customer service! We were met by very friendly Jay Landings greeters as soon as we pulled into the marina who were helpful with all of our questions and getting us unpacked and settled in our boat for a long weekend stay. They also gave us a list of fun things to do and see along the Tennessee River. Bathrooms and facilities were clean and well-lit, and LOTS of great fishing!! We definitely plan on coming back!!

name: Julie Ryan
text:
It's a beautiful places with a lot of recent upgrades. Very nicely recently renovated shower suites, nice pool, beautiful fire pit areas to watch the sunset.

The downsides are that the spots (especially the pullthroughs)are really small and cramped, the road into and through the campground while recently repaved is very narrow, the wifi is terrible, and the bugs are aplenty. We also noticed trash buildup in our sewage receptacle and broken glass all around our site.

Based on older reviews, it appears they are taking steps to really improve the park and we hope that now that they've done some major things they'll take a look at the small things.

We'd also suggest they update their website with correct pricing as the price we were charged was about 25% higher than what their website quotes.

name: Rosemary Swanner
text: We stayed for July 4th holiday. Was a great vacation. The new pool was awesome. And the staff was very nice. Will go back soon.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, Rosemary!  We're pleased to hear from you, especially that you enjoyed the pool!

name: Terry Mims
text: Great people. Very easy to deal with.

name: Melissa Flowers
text: I had a great time. If ever in Bama again, I would love to stay here.

resp.text: We would love to welcome your return. Thank you!

name: Loren Gard
text:
Stopped for the night while traveling.  Parked lake front with a great view. When we checked in the guy could not have been nicer. Price was very reasonable.
It was not crowded.

We were offered the free use of kayaks if we wanted.

A great stop over when traveling. Stop short of the 280 space parking lot and have a waterfront wooded lot.

name: David Jones
text:
Beautiful grounds with a peaceful and tranquil setting. Many amenities are close by. The owners are fantastic and treat you like family.

The facilities are spotless and the store is well stocked with boat supplies.

The boat repair service was done right the first time at very reasonable prices.

All in all we love this place and the people.

name: Chris White
text: I stayed here for the week of January 7-12 and it’s a very nice place. The staff is super friendly and helpful. It’s nice and quite plus it’s close to town but you don’t get all of the noise. I had a pretty easy time finding this place and easy to get into I would definitely recommend this place to anyone

name: Debbie L
text: We stayed the Memorial Day weekend here. We drove from Florida. Elizabeth and Joel were amazing hosts. They were extremely helpful and friendly. The park is well maintained. The bathrooms were clean. The price is right and the view was amazing. Definitely will be returning for the 41st Annual Hot Air Balloon Festival and will stay at Jay's Landing and Marina. I already have my reservation made.

name: Sher Keb
text:
Very similar to roughing it by the river with electric, water and sewer.

Regardless of anything (State or personal emergencies), reservations not cancelled 7 days in advance are not refundable where other campgrounds did give us a refund due to a state declared emergency. On May 27, 2018 when “The governors of Alabama, Florida and Mississippi declared a state of emergency in their states as Subtropical Storm Alberto spread north and west.
As for a overall review of Jay’s Landing in Decatur Alabama, see below:

Con’s:
-Interface with management done only by phone. Reservation, check-in & problem resolution.
-400 feet of very pot holed narrow driveway. Many potholes in little bit of asphalt then much more potholes in the more clay than gravel drive. (Very muddy when it rains)
-More long term “campers” in the park then recreational RV campers
-Paper litter, cigarette butts, nut & bolts, metal scraps found on camp sites.
-Bathroom & shower building is far from camping sites
-Sites are close to each other
-No fishing allowed.

Pro’s
- 2 unisex bathrooms & showers were clean
-Site utilities (electric, water & sewer) are convenient. Electric 30 amp circuit showed good connection and grounding.
-Reservation email sent with a site map document with your site.
-Picnic tables at each site.
-Nice river view
'Common area gazebo with a fire pit and a little playground.

Has the makings of a nice RV park… Someday

name: Dannyy Thompson
text: Nice views and good for families

name: millie boyken
text: Fishing was good and camping was good

name: Mike Bafundo
text: It's a nice quite place on the lake. They staff is friendly and very helpful. It's a nice home away from home while working in Huntsville.

text:
A one night stay turned into four days. Would highly recommend this campground to fellow
Good Sam Club Members.  The managers, the Gipson's are so nice and and go out
of their way to make your stay a good one.  The view of Wheeler lake from your site
is beautiful.and so relaxing.
A & C King

We just spent two days at Jays Landings RV Park, and found it a great place to stay a day or so while traveling.  It was very relaxing watching the boats on the Tennessee River.  The owner and staff were very helpful and made our stay very enjoyable.

Suzie & Darrell

text: Growing and improving every year love to see that thanks

resp.text: We are trying!  Thank you for noticing and making a comment!!!  We hope to be complete by late Spring next year.

text: We love Jay Landings Marina.  My wife and I spend a weekend there every summer and the owners are some of the most hospitable and friendly people we've ever met.  Our kids love the game areas they have almost as much as they love the chickens!  We will be back again soon!

name: matt chitwood racing
